snippet: The capture of Kunduz was timed to the American withdrawal, a steady influx of insurgent fighters, a series of territory grabs and a campaign that took advantage of resentment of the government.
abstract: Taliban's seizure of northern Afghan city of Kunduz in matter of hours reflects years of determination and planning; militants took advantage of security lapses following 2013 American troop withdrawal and negotiated with local governments and ethnic groups to ensure their success; fall of city raises possibility that Taliban will seize other large Afghan cities in  future.

byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Mexico City, Alissa J. Rubin from Kabul, and Douglas Schorzman from New York.

lead_paragraph: The capture of Kunduz was timed to the American withdrawal, a steady influx of insurgent fighters, a series of territory grabs and a campaign that took advantage of resentment of the government.

headline.main: A Taliban Prize, Won in a Few Hours After Years of Strategy
headline.print_headline: A Taliban Prize, Seized in a Few Hours After Years of Strategy

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
